abstract.text: Asks the file provider for the metadata of the provided item.

inlineContent.text: The item’s identifier.
An object that identifies the context of that request, such as the requesting app.
A block that you call after downloading the item’s metadata. The block takes the following parameters:
A new file provider item, containing all the item’s metadata.
If an error occurs, this object contains information about the error; otherwise, it’s
An item that tracks your extension’s progress. The system automatically calls
on the progress object when an error occurs.
If your extension doesn’t recognize the item, pass

to the handler. The system assumes the item is no longer in the domain, and attempts to delete the local copy. If the delete attempt fails because the item has local changes, the system reimports the item by calling
If you pass
or
to the handler, the system presents an appropriate alert to the user, but doesn’t try to access the metadata until triggered again by the user.
The system considers any other errors to be transient, and automatically retries the method call.

abstract.text: An extension other apps use to access files and folders managed by your app and synced with a remote storage.
An error indicating that the specified item doesn’t exist.
An error indicating that you can’t verify the user’s credentials.
An error indicating that the File Provider extension can’t reach the remote server.
An item the File Provider extension manages.
A unique identifier for an item managed by the File Provider extension.
A File Provider extension in which the system replicates the contents on disk.
Tells the file provider to create or import an item based on a template.
Tells the file provider to download the requested item from remote storage.
Asks the file provider for the metadata of the provided item.
An object that provides information about the application requesting data from the File Provider extension.
Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
An object that conveys ongoing progress to the user for a specified task.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.
